Dear Mr. Roach:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations, report why the previous CAPs were unsuccessful.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

ALLEGATION:
On 7/16/21, a staff member at the facility threatened to burn all of a youth's toys.
Staff member pushed youth against the wall by the throat when they attempted to
protect their toys. Youth hit their head on the wall and has a mark on their face from
the incident.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received on 07/19/21 and investigated jointly with the DHHS
Specialist. Consultant 2 was also present during the 07/20/21 interviews. The
complainant reported the following:
Youth A (12) lives at Methodist Children's Home. Staff 1 is an employee at the
home. On 7/16/21, Staff 1 threatened to burn all of Youth A’s toys. Youth A ran to
his room to protect his toys and Staff 1 pushed him against a wall by his throat.
Youth A hit his head on the wall and currently has a mark on his face from the
incident. Youth A has been taken to an urgent care to be evaluated. Youth A was
sent home and is suspended pending an investigation.
I interviewed Youth A on 07/20/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist. Youth A
reported that this incident occurred on 07/16/21 when Staff 1 said that she was
going to burn his “stuffies” and that she had a lighter. Youth A said he had been
acting out (standing on the couch, being hyper, and jumping around). Youth A said
that he ran to his room to protect the stuffed animals and on the way Staff 1 took him
by the neck and put him against the wall. This reportedly occurred by the bathroom
near his room. Youth A explained that Staff 1 grabbed his neck with one hand from
the front. Youth A said that Staff 2 and Youths B and C saw this occur and Youth A
said that Staff 2 was shocked. When asked how he knew Staff 2 was shocked,
Youth A said that Staff 2 put her hands up over her face. Youth A said that Staff 1 let
go of him and Youth A ran out the door. Youth A was not sure how long Staff 1 held
his neck, indicating he “blacked out.” Youth A said he ran to another cottage where
another staff let him in and talked to the Supervisor. Youth A said that he told the
Supervisor what happened. Youth A said he was taken to urgent care by Staff 2, and
he did not have any marks, bruises, or scratches. Youth A said Staff 1 left after he
ran out of the cottage, and he has not seen her since. Youth A said that he feels
safe, has been at the facility for about six months and nothing like this has happened
to him before.
I interviewed Youth B on 07/20/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist. Youth B was not
forthcoming during the interview and reported that he did not want to talk about this
because Staff 1 is his favorite staff and is good to him. Youth B said that he was not
going to “snitch” on Staff 1 and have her get her own child removed from her. Youth
A said that she might get her child taken because other DHHS workers came to talk
to some people, and they had come to his house when he was taken from his
mother. Youth B did not provide much detail related to the incident, and only
confirmed that he saw Youth A run toward his room.
4

I interviewed Youth C on 07/20/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist. Youth C
provided a consistent account of the incident with Youth A’s. Youth C could not
recall how or where on Youth A’s body that Staff 1 grabbed Youth A. Youth C stated
that Staff 1 was forcing Youth A to apologize for spitting on Staff 1 in another
incident. Youth C went on to report that Staff 1 had grabbed him a couple of months
ago by his hands and put him in the corner near the kitchen table.
I interviewed Staff 2 via phone, jointly with the DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been at
the facility less than three months. Staff 2 recalled this incident and reported that
Staff 1 was angry from a prior incident when Youth A spit on Staff 1. Staff 1 wanted
an apology, but Youth A was not giving it. Staff 2 said that Staff 1 was standing over
Youth A and intimidating him. Youth A was crying, distressed, and trying to get away
from Staff 1. Staff 2 recalled Staff 1 saying she was going to get a lighter and burn
Youth A’s stuffed animals. Youth A ran to his room and there was a verbal
altercation between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 said that Youth A left from the door
for a moment and Staff 1 approached his bedroom door. Youth A ran back to the
door and tried to get in the room. Staff 2 said that Staff 1 grabbed Youth A and
pushed him against the wall. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was pushing Youth A up and lifting
him by the neck/throat and choking him with her hand. When Youth A was let down,
he ran out the door and to the cottage next door. Staff 2 said that she followed and
heard Youth A tell the Supervisor what happened. Staff 2 then took Youth A to
urgent care and said that they did not find any injuries. Staff 2 said that Staff 1 left
the facility after the incident, and she has not spoken to Staff 1 since then.
I interviewed the Supervisor via phone, on 08/11/21, jointly with the DHHS
Specialist. The Supervisor reported that Youth A ran to the cottage where he was
and was crying. Youth A then told the Supervisor that Staff 1 choked him and
pushed him into the wall. The Supervisor said that Staff 2 was with Youth A and
verified what Youth A said. The Supervisor said that he sent Staff 1 home, filed the
complaint with DHHS, and notified management. The Supervisor said that he spoke
to Staff 1 when she called him to say that she had a family emergency. The
Supervisor said that he told Staff 1 to go home and that he would have had to send
her home anyway because of what happened with Youth A. The Supervisor said that
Staff 1 replied that nothing happened with Youth A and that she didn’t do anything to
Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 1 via phone, on 08/11/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist. Staff 1
recalled this incident and reported that she had told the boys that she was leaving
and that would be her last day. Staff 1 said that Youth A had spit at her the day prior
and he brought it up and was mad at Staff 1. Staff 1 said that she began talking to
other youth and Youth A continued to act up, so she told him to go to his room. Staff
1 said that Youth A went by his bedroom door and asked her to open it. When Staff
1 went to open the door, she said that Youth A charged at her with full force. Staff 1
said that she backed Youth A up into the wall with her forearm across Youth A’s
collar bones. Staff 1 said that when she let Youth A go, he ran out the door and Staff
5

2 ran after him. Staff 1 denied threatening to burn Youth A’s toys. Staff 1 said that
she called the Supervisor and notified him that she had received a call about a death
in the family and had to leave. Staff 1 said that Youth A was not taken to the hospital
that night, noting he wasn’t taken until two days later.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation is as follows, with appliable
information outlined:
 Incident Report, dated 07/16/21, authored by Staff 2. The report was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview. The report was not approved by a
supervisor. On 07/20/21, Administrator 1 said that she had asked for revisions
to the Incident Report. On 08/24/21, Administrator 1 emailed that she never
got the revised Incident Report, and that staff is no longer employed there.
 Urgent Care report for Youth A, dated 07/16/21. The report identified that
Staff 2 reported a consistent account of what occurred to Youth A. Youth A
denied complaint of injury. Diagnosis-closed head injury. No obvious signs of
trauma seen on examination. Patient has normal neurological examination.
 07/16/21 Letter from the Director of Administrative Services to Staff 1
confirming Staff 1’s verbal resignation that day.
 Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed for disciplinary action:
o 05/27/21-Progressive Disciplinary Action, Staff 1 failed to use de-
escalation techniques she was trained on, which lead to a
confrontation with a youth. Coworkers stepped in and walked Staff 1
out of the cottage. A licensing violation resulted. Staff 1 was put on
administrative leave for three weeks.
 Staff 1’s Crisis Prevention Institute training was updated 06/04/21 per a
provided training log.
 08/25/21 email from the DHHS Specialist identifying that the individual was
deemed unsuitable.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
(c) Verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
ANALYSIS: Youth A’s interview was consistent with interview from Staff 2
and Youth C, as well as the written incident report, which
reported that Staff 1 threatened to burn Youth A’s stuffed
animals and then pushed him against the wall by his neck.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule as Staff 1 demonstrated an
inability to perform the duties of the position assigned evidenced
by her threatening Youth A and pushing him into the wall by his
neck. Additionally, the findings of the DHHS Specialist’s
investigation resulted in findings of unsuitability with regard to
Staff 1.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting a timely,
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violations.
